Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the game board for Tic-Tac-Toe. The board is a 3x3 grid where players can place their markers ('X' or 'O').

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected char[][]
    cells
    The 3x3 grid to store markers ('X' or 'O').

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board()
    Constructs a new empty board and initializes it by calling the clear method.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    clear()
    Clears the entire board by setting all cells to an empty state.
    boolean
    isCellEmpty(int x, int y)
    Checks if a specific cell on the board is empty.
    boolean
    isFull()
    Checks if the board is full, i.e., if all cells are occupied.
    void
    place(int x, int y, char marker)
    Places a marker on the specified cell if the cell is empty.
    void
    print()
    Prints the current state of the TicTacToe board to the console.

  • Field Details

    • cells

      protected char[][] cells
      The 3x3 grid to store markers ('X' or 'O').

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a new empty board and initializes it by calling the clear method.

  • Method Details

    • isCellEmpty

      public boolean isCellEmpty(int x, int y)
      Checks if a specific cell on the board is empty.
      Parameters:
      x - The row index of the cell.
      y - The column index of the cell.
      Returns:
      true if the cell is empty, false otherwise.

    • place

      public void place(int x, int y, char marker)
      Places a marker on the specified cell if the cell is empty.
      Parameters:
      x - The row index of the cell.
      y - The column index of the cell.
      marker - The marker to be placed ('X' or 'O').

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the board is full, i.e., if all cells are occupied.
      Returns:
      true if the board is full, false otherwise.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the entire board by setting all cells to an empty state.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the current state of the TicTacToe board to the console. The board is displayed with borders, and each cell contains either a marker or a space if the cell is empty. The top and bottom borders consist of horizontal lines, and vertical lines separate each cell. The printed representation provides a visual representation of the current state of the game board.
